Based on the following passage, determine the author’s attitude towards the idea that speed is the most important factor in production
The focus on speed in production today is often misguided. Technical proficiency and craftsmanship can take a backseat to the urgency to finish a project quickly. This can be detrimental to the quality of the product, as the diligent worker is not going to be given the time to fix any mistakes that might arise from haste.

The author's attitude towards the idea that speed is the most important factor in production is critical. The passage suggests that the emphasis on speed is often misguided and that prioritizing speed over technical proficiency and craftsmanship can harm the quality of the product. The author appears to value diligence and quality over the urgency to complete projects quickly, indicating a negative view of prioritizing speed above other important factors in production.
